channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Very hard material in drain slots on both sides of the road, 12th August
item.description:
Occasionally on Chislehurst Road there is flash flooding on this road. The water level is high and buses, cars have to drive through very slowly. The drains looking like this doesn't help. It would be much appreciated if someone could either unblock completely all 3 drains, 2 outside 31 Chislehurst Road Orpington and 1 drain opposite. Thank you for reading these notes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Red Cedars Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing traffic preventing bollards, 12th August
item.description:
The footpath that leads from Kent House Lane down to Cricket Lane, the allotments and Kangley Bridge Road is missing traffic preventing concrete bollards. At one end of the pathway there are two concrete bollards (as shown in the attached image) however, on the other end at Kent House Lane there are no bollards, which therefore allows vehicles to drive down this footpath. This has been used for crime related purposes over the past year, criminals have driven cars and vans down the footpath towards the industrial units and have stolen goods from the businesses at Beckenham Business Centre. Concrete bollards should be erected at the Kent House Lane end of the footpath as a priority.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kent House Lane, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Castle Road j/o Hadley Street o/s the Tapping The Admiral pub., 12th August
item.description:
There have been bonkers roadworks on Castle Road at the end of a cul de sac. Ridiculous waste of money as it is a dead end. However, it is what it is and the fire gates have been replaced by bollards and two have not been put in yet (either side). On Friday 08 August late afternoon, a pedestrian fell into a gaping hold where a bollard should be, causing her to smash her face on the concrete. The publican and some guests assisted in helping the woman get cleaned up from all the blood, damage, etc while waiting for an ambulance. The contractor should be sued for leaving this pavement in a state. What are you going to do about this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Castle Road, Kentish Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle in poor state., 12th August
item.description:

item.title: Huge black bags of commercial waste Fly tipped by No2 Chinese, 12th August
item.description:
No 2 Chinese fly tips outside slique spa almost every day. Huge black bags filled with commercial waste which they try to pass off as household, a lot of it isn’t even sealed, so there ends up with animals and bugs and makes the streets disgusting

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 81, Norwood Road, Herne Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
